title: Tourists Will Soon Be Allowed In J&K As Governor Lifts Restrictions After 2 Months
text:
Tourists Will Soon Be Allowed In J&K As Governor Lifts Restrictions After 2 Months

Tourists Will Soon Be Allowed In J&K As Governor Lifts Restrictions After 2 Months

After Home Minister Amit Shah announced the government’s decision of scrapping Section 370 on August 5, 2019, things were not in good shape in the valley. Jammu and Kashmir Governor Satya Pal Malik directed an advisory which had asked tourists to leave the valley due to ‘terror threat.'

The administration had also imposed security restrictions like the arrest of the state’s political leaders, snapping of phone and telephone lines and deployment of additional troops - to prevent any backlash to the move.

Now in a major step, the two-month-old advisory has been lifted by the governor of Jammu and Kashmir. The withdrawal of the advisory will take effect on October 10. Now you can visit the beautiful valley and enjoy the scenic view of Dal Lake again!

Himanshi Dadhich

“The Governor directed that the Home Department's advisory asking tourists to leave the valley be lifted immediately. This will be done w.e.f. 10.10.2019," the Jammu and Kashmir administration's information department said.

Article 370 granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir and gave the power to the state legislature in defining its ‘permanent residents’ as also their privileges and rights.

Malik issued the directive for lifting the security advisory for tourists at a ‘situation-cum-security-review’ meeting with the advisors and the chief secretary here, an official spokesman said.
